EnglishScore: All international applicants whose primary language is not English must submit an official score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics

EnglishScore: In addition, applicants for whom English is not the primary language must attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS-Academic). A minimum score of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (Internet-based) on the TOEFL is required. The IELTS-Academic test is also accepted with a minimum score of 6.0. Completion of an ELS Language Center's program (level 112) with a grade of B or better is also accepted.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation and Aerospace Sustainability

EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the primary language must demonstrate English proficiency by taking one of the following exams: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), Cambridge English Language Assessment, Duolingo. Successful completion of an approved ESL program (ex. ELS Level 112) may also be accepted in lieu of test scores.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Small Uncrewed Aircraft Systems (sUAS) Operations

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their primary language must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (PBT) or 79 (IBT). OR Attain a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. OR Attain a minimum score on the Duolingo English Test of 105. OR Successfully complete an English Language Course (ELS) with a score of 112. OR Earn a baccalaureate or graduate degree from a college or university where English is the primary language of instruction.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Uncrewed and Autonomous Systems

EnglishScore: If English is not your primary language, you must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) or the Duolingo English Test (DET); Provide a transcript from a school where English is the official language of instruction; or Present a certificate of completion from an approved English as a Second Language (ESL) program.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Space Operations

EnglishScore: English proficiency is required for applicants whose primary language is not English. For on-campus programs (Daytona Beach, Prescott), accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), or Duolingo (minimum 105 for Prescott, case-by-case for Daytona Beach). For the Worldwide & Online program, accepted tests are TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT or 550 paper-based) or IELTS (minimum 6.0).
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation Safety

EnglishScore: Official scores from an English Language proficiency exam are required for all international applicants whose primary language is not English. Minimum scores required for admission are: TOEFL iBT: 79; IELTS: 6.0; Duolingo: 105; PTE Academic: 53; or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Human Factors

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Embry-Riddle accepts official scores from TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0 overall), Duolingo (minimum 105), PTE Academic (minimum 53), or successful completion of ELS Language Centers' Level 112. The requirement may be waived under certain conditions.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation Maintenance

EnglishScore: For applicants whose primary language is not English, proficiency must be demonstrated. Accepted tests and recommended minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 79 (or PBT 550), IELTS 6.0, Duolingo 105, or PTE 53. Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also accepted. Waivers are available for applicants who meet certain criteria.
Program name: Master of Science in Aeronautics with Specialization in Aviation Cybersecurity

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must demonstrate proficiency in English through one of the following methods: TOEFL (iBT minimum 79, PBT minimum 550), IELTS (minimum 6.0 overall band score), Duolingo (minimum 105), ELS Language Center (completion of ELS Language Center level 112), Cambridge English Language Assessment (minimum 170), or Pearson PTE Academic (minimum 53).
Program name: Master of Science in Aerospace Business Analytics

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take either the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). A minimum TOEFL score of 550 (PBT) or 79 (IBT), or an IELTS score of 6.0 is required. Applicants who have attended a school where English is the primary language of instruction may be exempt from this requirement.
Program name: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering

EnglishScore: For international applicants, a minimum Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 79, an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0, or a Duolingo score of 105 is required. Successful completion of ELS Level 112 is also accepted.
Program name: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering with Concentration in Aerodynamics, Propulsion, Computational Aero and Fluid Dynamics, Transition and Turbulence, Aeroacoustics, Heat Transfer, and Combustion

EnglishScore: For international applicants, English Language Proficiency must be demonstrated by one of the following methods: a minimum TOEFL score of 79 iBT (or 550 PBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum Duolingo score of 105, or successful completion of an ELS Language Center's intensive program at Level 112. Other methods of proving proficiency are also accepted.
Program name: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering with Concentration in Dynamics and Control

EnglishScore: Applicants whose primary language is not English must either: Earn a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT) or 550 on the paper-based test (PBT). Earn a minimum score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). Earn a minimum score of 53 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic. Successfully complete an English Language course through an approved language partner (ELS, EC, etc.). Earn a minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test (DET).
Program name: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering with Concentration in Structures and Materials

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (Internet-based). OR Attain a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. OR Attain a minimum score on the Duolingo English Test of 105. OR Successfully complete an English Language course (ESL) at an accredited post-secondary institution.
Program name: Master of Science in Airline Management

EnglishScore: International applicants must prove English Language Proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL iBT (79), TOEFL PBT (550), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo (105), or Pearson PTE Academic (53). Successful completion of ELS Level 112 is also accepted. Exemptions may apply.
Program name: Master of Science in Airport and Air Mobility Management

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose primary language is not English. Any of the following are acceptable: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 79 iBT (internet-based test) or 550 PBT (paper-based test); International English Language Test System (IELTS) score of 6.0; Duolingo score of 105; Completion of an approved ESL program (ex. ELS Level 112); A transcript from a secondary school, college, or university where English is the official language of instruction.
Program name: Master of Science in Airworthiness Engineering

EnglishScore: For applicants for whom English is not their primary language, a minimum score is required on one of the following tests: TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo (105), or Pearson VUE (53). Completion of an approved English as a Second Language (ESL) program, such as the ELS Language Centers program at Level 112, may also be accepted.
Program name: Master of Science in Aviation

EnglishScore: International applicants must be proficient in English. If English is not your primary language, you must either: Submit official scores for the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) academic, or Duolingo. Have attended a school at the secondary level or above for at least one year where English is the language of instruction. Successfully complete the English Language Services (ELS) Level 112.
Program name: Master of Business Administration in Aviation Management

EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following methods: TOEFL (minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test or 550 on the paper-based test), IELTS (minimum overall band score of 6.0), Duolingo (minimum score of 105), or completion of ELS Level 112 with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Science

EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by providing a score from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo, or the Cambridge English Language Assessment. Applicants may be exempt from submitting a proficiency score if they have successfully completed an English as a Second Language (ESL) program at an accredited institution, or have earned a degree from an institution in which English was the primary language of instruction.
Program name: Master of Science in Data Science

EnglishScore: If English is not your primary language, you must submit an official score from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo English Test, Pearson Test of English (PTE), Cambridge English Language Assessment. The English proficiency requirement may be waived if a student has successfully completed an English composition course with a grade of "B" or better from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or if the student is from an English-speaking country.
Program name: Master of Science in Engineering Management

EnglishScore: International applicants for whom English is not the primary language must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (PBT) or 79 (IBT); OR Attain a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0; OR Earn transferable credit for a course that is the equivalent of ENGL 123 (English Composition) at an accredited postsecondary institution; OR Successfully complete a course of study at an ELS Language Center.
Program name: Master of Science in Human Factors

EnglishScore: International applicants are required to have English Language proficiency scores.
Program name: Master of Science in Human Security and Resilience

EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the primary language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following methods: Completion of the ELS Language Centers' (ELS) Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA or higher; Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of: 79 iBT (internet based test) or 550 PBT (paper based test); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0; Duolingo English Test (DET) with a score of 105; Pearson PTE Academic score of 53; Cambridge English Scale score of 170.
Program name: Master of Science in Management

EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must submit a score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test. Successful completion of an ELS Language Center course (Level 112) with a recommendation from the ELS Center Director may also be used to satisfy the English proficiency requirement.
Program name: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering

EnglishScore: Applicants whose primary language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by providing an official score report of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test. A minimum score of 79 on the internet based TOEFL (iBT), or 6.0 on the IELTS is required. On the Duolingo English Test, a minimum score of 105 is required for admission. Students who have earned a degree from an institution where English is the primary language of instruction are not required to submit a proof of English proficiency test score.
Program name: Master of Science in Occupational Safety Management

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their primary language must either: Attest to being a native English speaker OR Submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo. A minimum score of 79 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), or 550 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT). A minimum total score of 6.0 on the IELTS. A minimum score of 105 on Duolingo. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers' Level 112.
Program name: Master of Science in Space Operations

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must demonstrate proficiency by one of the following methods: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT (minimum score 79), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) academic test (minimum score 6.0), Duolingo English test (minimum score 105), Pearson Vue English test (minimum score 53), or successful completion of an English language course (ELS Language Centers Level 112) with a certificate.
Program name: Master of Science in Systems Engineering

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must submit official results from one of the following internationally recognized English language proficiency tests: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test.
Program name: Master of Science in Uncrewed Systems

EnglishScore: If the applicant's master's degree is from an institution where the primary language of instruction is not English, then the applicant must either earn a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (Internet-based), or a minimum score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. This English proficiency requirement can be waived if the applicant successfully completes the English for Academic Purposes Program (EAPP) offered by the Embry-Riddle Language Institute (ERLI).
Program name: PhD in Aerospace Engineering

EnglishScore: All applicants whose primary language is not English must submit a satisfactory score on an approved English language proficiency exam. Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University accepts several exams including TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, ELS Level 112, and PTE. Applicants can submit any one of these to satisfy the requirement.
Program name: PhD in Aviation

EnglishScore: International applicants must meet all admission requirements noted above. In addition, they must meet one of the following requirements for English language proficiency: Provide official scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) that meet the minimum requirements: TOEFL: a minimum score of 80 for the Internet-based test (iBT); IELTS: a minimum overall score of 6.0.
Program name: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Aviation Safety

EnglishScore: International applicants whose primary language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency. Embry-Riddle accepts several exams, including TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80), IELTS (minimum score 6.5), and Duolingo (minimum score 105).
Program name: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Aviation Human Factors

EnglishScore: Non-native English speakers must demonstrate proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT (79) or PBT (550), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo English Test (105), or Pearson PTE Academic (53).
Program name: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Aviation Operations

EnglishScore:
Applicants must meet one of the following requirements:
Have earned a degree (bachelors, masters or doctoral) from a U.S. regionally accredited institution.
Have earned a degree (bachelors, masters or doctoral) from an institution of higher education outside the U.S. in which English is the official language of the country and the language of instruction in which the degree was earned.
Submit an official test score report from one of our approved English language proficiency exams showing that the minimum score requirement has been met. The minimum score requirements for the Ph.D. in Aviation are listed below:
TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) iBT format: 80
IELTS (International English Language Testing System): 6.5
PTE (Pearson Test of English) Academic: 55
Duolingo: 110
Program name: PhD in Aviation with Specialization in Intradisciplinary

EnglishScore: For international applicants, a TOEFL score of 80 (iBT) or 6.5 IELTS is required.
Program name: Doctor of Aviation Business Administration

EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their primary language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following methods: a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT (Test of English as a Foreign Language, Internet-based test) or 550 on the TOEFL PBT (paper-based test); a minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS (International English Language Testing System); a minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test; a minimum score of 170 on the Cambridge English Language Assessment; or successful completion of an ELS (English Language Services) Language Center program, with a certificate of completion of level 112.
Program name: PhD in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science

EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by providing the results from any of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), Cambridge English Language Assessment, Duolingo, ELS Language Centers (ELS), or Pearson PTE Academic.
Program name: PhD in Engineering Physics

EnglishScore: For those whose primary language is not English, a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 213 (computer-based) or 79 (Internet-based) is required. The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam with a minimum score of 6.0 is also accepted. A score of 550 on the paper-based TOEFL is acceptable as long as it is accompanied by the Test of Written English with a score of at least 4.0.
Program name: PhD in Human Factors

EnglishScore: International students are required to provide TOEFL, IELTS, or Cambridge English scores. Other accepted methods to demonstrate proficiency include completing ELS Level 112, or achieving minimum scores on the Duolingo English Test or Pearson PTE Academic test.
Program name: PhD in Mechanical Engineering

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not the primary language must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum acceptable scores are: TOEFL 550 (paper-based) or 79 (iBT); IELTS 6.0; Cambridge English Language Assessment 170; Duolingo 105; PTE Academic 53; or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers' level 112 English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program.
Program name: Certificate in Airline Management

EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language must demonstrate English proficiency by one of several methods, including submitting scores for TOEFL (iBT score of 80), IELTS (overall score of 6.0), Duolingo (overall score of 105), PTE Academic (overall score of 53), or completing ELS Level 112. Other methods based on prior education in English are also accepted.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Airworthiness Engineering

EnglishScore: Students from a country where English is not the primary language must submit proof of English proficiency. The following are the minimum scores required for admission to a degree program: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language): 79 on iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on PBT (paper-based test); IELTS (International English Language Testing System): 6.0 overall band score; Duolingo English Test: 105; PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English): 53; Cambridge English Scale: 170; ELS Language Centers: Completion of Level 112.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Human Factors

EnglishScore: Students whose native language is not English are required to provide official scores from one of the following English language proficiency exams: TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0 overall band score), Cambridge English Language Assessment (170), Duolingo (105), Pearson PTE Academic (53), or ELS Language Centers (Completion of Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA).
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Marketing

EnglishScore: Applicants whose primary language is not English must either: Attain a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 550 (PBT) or 79 (iBT). The Embry-Riddle TOEFL code is 5190. Or Attain a minimum overall score on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) of 6.0. Or Show evidence of attendance and graduation from a secondary school in which the language of instruction was English. Or successfully complete a college-level English Composition course with a grade of C or better from a U.S. based college or university.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Project Management
